title: The European Commission receives the organisers of the 14th successful European citizens’ initiative
content:
The European Commission receives the organisers of the 14th successful European citizens’ initiative schuusa Tue, 02/24/2026 - 14:01

In line with Article 15 of the ECI Regulation, the organisers of 'Stop Destroying Videogames' were given the opportunity to explain the objectives of their initiative in detail. They were received on 23 February 2026 by Executive Vice-President Henna Virkunnen and Commissioner for Democracy, Justice, the Rule of Law, and Consumer Protection Michael McGrath, accompanied by European Commission o

title: Commission partially registers a citizens' initiative on stray dogs, stray cats and animals in shelters
content:
Commission partially registers a citizens' initiative on stray dogs, stray cats and animals in shelters walenba Thu, 02/05/2026 - 12:30

On 10 February, the Commission partially registered a European Citizens' Initiative entitled ‘EU initiative to protect stray dogs, stray cats and animals in shelters in the EU/non-EU countries’. 

The organisers call on the Commission to “strengthen the protection of stray dogs, stray cats and animals in shelters in the EU and to ensure that EU action in third countries does
creator: walenba

title: Public hearing on ‘Ban on conversion practices in the EU’ in the European Parliament
content:
Public hearing on ‘Ban on conversion practices in the EU’ in the European Parliament schuusa Tue, 01/27/2026 - 16:47

On 2 March, the European Parliament will hold a public hearing on the 13th successful European citizens' initiative 'Ban on conversion practices in the European Union'. 

Source
creator: schuusa

title: ECI Day on 3 March 2026 - with participation of Commissioner Šefčovič
content:
ECI Day on 3 March 2026 - with participation of Commissioner Šefčovič schuusa Tue, 01/27/2026 - 15:49

The next edition of European Citizens’ Initiative (ECI) Day will take place on Tuesday, 3 March 2026, as part of the Civil Society Week. The event is organised by the European Economic and Social Committee under the title ‘People, Democracy, Resilience – Our Future!’

ECI Day brings together organisers, civil society and EU institutions to discuss, network and exchange ideas and good practices around the ECI. There will be high-level panel discussions and practical workshops.

Maro
creator: schuusa

title: 14th valid initiative ‘Stop Destroying Videogames’ submitted to the Commission for examination
content:
14th valid initiative ‘Stop Destroying Videogames’ submitted to the Commission for examination walenba Wed, 01/21/2026 - 12:10

On 26 January 2026, the organisers of the European citizens' initiative ‘Stop Destroying Videogames’  submitted it to the European Commission for examination, after the verification phase was successfully completed. 

The 14th successful initiative has gathered 1,294,188 verified statements of support from EU citizens, surpassing the required minimum of one million, and rea
creator: walenba

title: New initiative registered: ‘Stop Funding Russia’s War: Phase Out Harmful and Useless Russian Imports into the EU’
content:
New initiative registered: ‘Stop Funding Russia’s War: Phase Out Harmful and Useless Russian Imports into the EU’ walenba Wed, 01/21/2026 - 11:48

On 29 January, the European Commission registered a European citizens' initiative entitled ‘Stop Funding Russia’s War: Phase Out Harmful and Useless Russian Imports into the EU’.

The initiative invites the Commission to propose measures to end the EU’s remaining import dependencies on Russia and Belarus by introducing sectoral bans or decisive phase-outs.

creator: walenba

title: Debate on 'My Voice, My Choice' ECI in the EESC plenary session
content:
Debate on 'My Voice, My Choice' ECI in the EESC plenary session walenba Wed, 01/14/2026 - 11:39

The European Economic and Social Committee (EESC) will hold a debate on the successful European citizens' initiative "My Voice, My Choice: For Safe And Accessible Abortion" in its plenary session on Wednesday 21 January 2026. The debate is linked to the adoption of the EESC opinion on this initiative.

Webstreaming is available.
creator: walenba

title: New initiative registered: ‘Ethics, Transparency and Integrity for European Political Parties’
content:
New initiative registered: ‘Ethics, Transparency and Integrity for European Political Parties’ walenba Wed, 12/17/2025 - 13:10

On 5 January, the European Commission registered a European citizens' initiative entitled ‘Ethics, Transparency and Integrity for European Political Parties’.

The initiative invites the Commission ‘to devise a European model of ethical governance based on transparency, integrity and shared responsibility’. The initiative organisers have six months to open the signature collection.

creator: walenba
